name: phil white
text: Very nice, clean and easy walking. It’s not a very big place but it is apart of Alabama history.

name: Alyssa White
text: A must see

name: Christopher Watts
text: Nice little stop and a bit of history.

name: Wyatt H
text: Amazing history.

name: Megan King
text: Buried my father here this year. They were so helpful and really take great care of the grounds.

name: T “Lady T” CL
text: Although, our visit here was for a sad occasion, the peacefulness and welcoming atmosphere made the burial more bearable. The place is very well maintained. I think it is such a blessing to see the effort put forth to ensure our men and women who served have an impeccable place of final rest.

name: Jason Senn
text: The most disgraceful thing in life, one could do, might be what I witnessed at Alabama National Cemetery. Apparently someone overbooked and my friends funeral was rushed out of the cemetery. The family did get a graveside, instead they got to look at heavy equipment and four employees lowering my friend in his grave from across the street. After this everyone was asked to move their cars because they had another funeral coming through. Total time for my friends funeral was about 30 minutes. My friend was a Lt Colonel of the Army. It was an embarrassment to our country and Alabama National Cemetery.

name: Tina Sprayberry
text: I had no idea this was here in Alabama.  Beautiful!  I'm here right before veterans day and every maker has its flag.  Thank you for your service!

name: Cindy Mcelroy
text: This was the perfect place to lay my dad to rest. So quiet and peaceful. Veterans take care of this place so you can be assured it is in good hands. Everyone was so nice and had genuine care for my loss. You can feel in your heart that Gods  presence is here to comfort the pain of loss. My dad was a Vietnam veteran that suffered a lot of depression in his life but now he is free. There is a scenic view that has a running stream that I could envision my dad sitting on the creek bank fishing..he loved to fish..hunt.. anything outdoors..going to miss him dearly.

name: Selena Harland
text: Beautiful, well maintained resting place for the men and women that served our country.

name: Karen Berryhill
text: Both of my parents are here,  and the staff has always been helpful and kind.

name: M. Connell
text: Lovely and peaceful.  This is a very large cemetery of 479 acres. It's a perfect resting place for military, and spouses can be buried there also.  Be aware that there are no benches out among the grave sites.  If you are attending a burial there, you will need to follow all instructions, all enter the cemetery in your cars at the same time, and most importantly - be on time.  Once you're there, you'll find this is a moving memorial of those who've served our country.

name: Marti Garrett
text: My son was buried there 5 years ago. The service was amazing. It is a beautiful well kept cemetery. I'm so proud my son is laid to rest there. Thank y'all for the things you do. Such a peaceful place.

name: Anthony Crosby
text: We honor all VETERANS AND THERE LOVE ONE'S AND I AM A PROUD ARMY VETERAN

name: Jessica o.
text: It is a beautiful cemetery.  I am thankful they keep it so clean and neat.  My stepdad is buried here and it is so nice to be able to find his headstone without trouble.

name: dave allen
text: My parents were buried there in late November, 2017.  My father was a WWII U.S. Navy veteran and was married to my mother for 67 years.  They died four days apart--Mother on 11-19-17 and my dad on Thanksgiving Day.  In spite of the challenges with separate burials, the cemetery staff could not have been more professional and kind.  It is a special place managed and maintained by an exceptional staff.

name: Susan Viola
text: Thankful that my husband is buried here! This is a wonderful place for those who have served our country! Grounds are always beautiful!

name: Anthony Roberts
text: Everyone should take a tour of this place at least once. The grounds are wonderfully kept and everything always appears pristine. It's a very sobering experience to see all of the heroes that died for this country.

name: Mike Logan
text: My son was laid to rest here a year ago.  So proud of him and so glad he laid to rest at such a beautiful place. Thank you all for your service.

name: Thomas A Wingate
text: Beautiful place. Well respected. Appreciate those who served our country.

name: Billy Martin
text: A beautiful well-maintained resting place for America's Heroes and their wives and or husbands

name: David Williams
text: I would be honored to have the privilege to be laid to rest in this hollowed place among my fellow veterans that served during the Korean War as I have had the Honor to serve my country . I served in the United States Navy

name: Emerson Johnston
text: Great honor to those who have served our country.

name: John Carillo
text: Seems odd to rate a cemetery but they are a respectful to the family of those who have served our country and especially the veteran who as they get their final salute from an honor guard that takes their service seriously.

name: James Roberts
text: A exceptionally well maintained cemetery that does honor to those that served!

name: Scott Crawford
text: Well kept and an honored place for those that served our country from Alabama the Beautiful.

name: Anglea Rice
text: It is a beautiful, well kept cemetery, and the internment process was well done. Glad that my father is resting there.

name: Patricia A. Luckett
text: Very  beautiful  place. Well managed  and peaceful.

name: Amanda Hicks Croom
text: Perfect place for military to rest

name: Donna Jones
text: Very peaceful,clean,well taken care of & respected.

name: Ashlie “Ashlie” McGlamery
text: The grounds seem to be kept very well.

name: Mary logan
text: Great and beautiful place

name: Cedric Crenshaw
text: VERY neat and clean

name: james walker
text: Well kept

name: Adileniy Ortega
text: you good
